page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: There are eight farms in this section. They vary in{size}from around 200 acres to over 1000 acres. The farms are mostly classed as{hill {farms}with large areas of rough grazing land. { Sheep}are the main livestock,the size of the flock is between 350 and 1000 animals.The breeds kept are Blackface and Mule,these cross well with types in other parts of the country as they are hardy stock coping with all weather conditions.Some farms have small herds of{cattle}starting with suckler cows and bulding up stock.The calves are sold at 6 months,a year or more. Most farmers buy in animal feed and produce their own hay or silage.They have a good selection of machines so they need few workers apart from the family or at busy times of the year.
